author: Staff Reporter
text:
More than one lakh children in the district will be immunised under pulse polio programme scheduled to be held on January 17 and February 21. Elaborate arrangements had been made for the same, said Collector N. Venkatachalam.

Addressing a meeting in this connection at the Collectorate near here on Monday, he said that 786 centres would be set up in the district.

More than 3,500 persons, including government employees, noon-meal staff, officials from Health, Education and Social Welfare departments, service organisations, non-governmental organisations and members of Rotary Clubs, will be engaged in this work.

The camp will begin around 7 a.m. at government hospitals, primary health centres, sub-centres, private hospitals and government schools and continue till 5 p.m.

Special centres will be set up at railway stations, bus stands, markets, among other public places. Administering polio drops will commence at 5 a.m. and continue till 10 p.m. in these centres.

Two-member team each would cover 150 to 200 houses in rural areas and 300 to 400 houses in urban areas, he added.
title: Polio immunisation on January 17, February 21
